com.google.enterprise.connector.util

Class TraversalTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.enterprise.connector.util.TraversalTimer

  • public class TraversalTimer
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple timer to control traversal loops and avoid batch timeouts.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TraversalTimer(TraversalContext traversalContext)
      Constructs a timer using the time limit of the TraversalContext.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isExpired()
      Gets whether the timer is expired.
      boolean isTicking()
      Gets whether the timer is still ticking.
      static void setDefaultTime(long time)
      Sets the default time in seconds.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TraversalTimer

        public TraversalTimer(TraversalContext traversalContext)
        Constructs a timer using the time limit of the TraversalContext.
        Parameters:
        traversalContext - the traversal context, which may be null

    • Method Detail

      • setDefaultTime

        public static void setDefaultTime(long time)
        Sets the default time in seconds.

      • isTicking

        public boolean isTicking()
        Gets whether the timer is still ticking.
        Returns:
        true if the timer interval has not elapsed, or false if it has elapsed

      • isExpired

        public boolean isExpired()
        Gets whether the timer is expired. This is the opposite of isTicking().
        Returns:
        true if the timer interval has elapsed, or false if it has not elapsed
